solution_line_template: He is buying {chicken_pounds} pounds of chicken and half that amount in hamburgers so he's buying {chicken_pounds}/{hamburger_divisor} = <<{chicken_pounds}/{hamburger_divisor}={hamburger_pounds}>>{hamburger_pounds} pounds of hamburgers

He's going to buy {hotdog_extra_pounds} more pounds of hotdogs than hamburgers, which are {hamburger_pounds} pounds so he'll have {hotdog_extra_pounds}+{hamburger_pounds} = <<{hotdog_extra_pounds}+{hamburger_pounds}={hotdog_pounds}>>{hotdog_pounds} pounds of hot dogs
He's going to buy sides that weigh half the amount of the hot dogs so that's {hotdog_pounds}/{sides_divisor} = <<{hotdog_pounds}/{sides_divisor}={sides_pounds}>>{sides_pounds} pounds of sides

He's buying {chicken_pounds} pounds of chicken, {hamburger_pounds} pounds of hamburgers, {hotdog_pounds} pounds of hot dogs and {sides_pounds} pounds of sides for a total of {chicken_pounds}+{hamburger_pounds}+{hotdog_pounds}+{sides_pounds} = <<{chicken_pounds}+{hamburger_pounds}+{hotdog_pounds}+{sides_pounds}={total_food_pounds}>>{total_food_pounds} pounds of food
